VRStageParameters.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The VRStageParameters interface of the WebVR API represents the values describing the stage area for devices that support room-scale experiences.

blockquote.para: This interface was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: This interface is accessible through the property.

VRStageParametersSittingToStandingTransf.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The sittingToStandingTransform read-only property of the interface contains a matrix that transforms the sitting-space view matrices of to standing-space.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: Basically, this can be passed into your WebGL code to transform the rendered view from a sitting to standing view.

VRStageParametersSittingToStandingTransf.value: A 16-element containing the components of a 4Ã—4 transform matrix.

VRStageParametersSizeX.summary: IMPORTANT Deprecated The sizeX read-only property of the interface returns the width of the play-area bounds in meters.

blockquote.para: This property was part of the old WebVR API. It has been superseded by the WebXR Device API.

remarks.para: The bounds are defined as an axis-aligned rectangle on the floor, for safety purposes. Content should not require the user to move beyond these bounds; however, it is possible for the user to ignore the bounds resulting in position values outside of this rectangle. The center of the rectangle is at (0,0,0) in standing-space coordinates.

VRStageParametersSizeX.value: A float representing the width in meters.
